channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: AdaCAD: Adaptively Decoding to Balance Conflicts between Contextual and Parametric Knowledge
item.description: Knowledge conflict arises from discrepancies between information in the context of a large language model (LLM) and the knowledge stored in its parameters.

item.title: Agent Workflow Memory
item.description: Despite the potential of language model-based agents to solve real-world tasks such as web navigation, current methods still struggle with long-horizon tasks with complex action trajectories.

item.title: Ontology-Free General-Domain Knowledge Graph-to-Text Generation Dataset Synthesis using Large Language Model
item.description: Our method proves to be a scalable and effective solution for generating high-quality G2T data, significantly advancing the field of G2T generation.

item.title: Asymptotics of Stochastic Gradient Descent with Dropout Regularization in Linear Models
item.description: This paper proposes an asymptotic theory for online inference of the stochastic gradient descent (SGD) iterates with dropout regularization in linear regression.

item.title: Policy Filtration in RLHF to Fine-Tune LLM for Code Generation
item.description: Reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF) is one of the key techniques that helps large language models (LLMs) to follow instructions and provide helpful and harmless responses.

item.title: CCFExp: Facial Image Synthesis with Cycle Cross-Fusion Diffusion Model for Facial Paralysis Individuals
item.description: Facial paralysis is a debilitating condition that affects the movement of facial muscles, leading to a significant loss of facial expressions.

item.title: A Fine-grained Sentiment Analysis of App Reviews using Large Language Models: An Evaluation Study
item.description: Given the volume of user reviews received daily, an automated mechanism to generate feature-level sentiment summaries of user reviews is needed.

item.title: EVENet: Evidence-based Ensemble Learning for Uncertainty-aware Brain Parcellation Using Diffusion MRI
item.description: The key innovation of EVENet is the design of an evidential deep learning framework to quantify predictive uncertainty at each voxel during a single inference.

item.title: Diff-VPS: Video Polyp Segmentation via a Multi-task Diffusion Network with Adversarial Temporal Reasoning
item.description: We incorporate multi-task supervision into diffusion models to promote the discrimination of diffusion models on pixel-by-pixel segmentation.

item.title: SUPER: Evaluating Agents on Setting Up and Executing Tasks from Research Repositories
item.description: To advance towards this goal, we introduce SUPER, the first benchmark designed to evaluate the capability of LLMs in setting up and executing tasks from research repositories.

item.title: Think Together and Work Better: Combining Humans' and LLMs' Think-Aloud Outcomes for Effective Text Evaluation
item.description: This study introduces \textbf{InteractEval}, a framework that integrates human expertise and Large Language Models (LLMs) using the Think-Aloud (TA) method to generate attributes for checklist-based text evaluation.

item.title: A Unified Contrastive Loss for Self-Training
item.description: To benefit from these advantages in a semi-supervised setting, we propose a general framework to enhance self-training methods, which replaces all instances of CE losses with a unique contrastive loss.

item.title: Securing Vision-Language Models with a Robust Encoder Against Jailbreak and Adversarial Attacks
item.description: Sim-CLIP+ demonstrates effectiveness against both gradient-based adversarial attacks and various jailbreak techniques.

item.title: Hi3D: Pursuing High-Resolution Image-to-3D Generation with Video Diffusion Models
item.description: Despite having tremendous progress in image-to-3D generation, existing methods still struggle to produce multi-view consistent images with high-resolution textures in detail, especially in the paradigm of 2D diffusion that lacks 3D awareness.

item.title: Data Augmentation via Latent Diffusion for Saliency Prediction
item.description: We propose a novel data augmentation method for deep saliency prediction that edits natural images while preserving the complexity and variability of real-world scenes.

item.title: Intrapartum Ultrasound Image Segmentation of Pubic Symphysis and Fetal Head Using Dual Student-Teacher Framework with CNN-ViT Collaborative Learning
item.description: The teacher model further reinforces learning within this architecture through the imposition of consistency regularization constraints.

item.title: TLD-READY: Traffic Light Detection -- Relevance Estimation and Deployment Analysis
item.description: On the DriveU dataset, this approach results in 96% accuracy in relevance estimation.

item.title: Attention Down-Sampling Transformer, Relative Ranking and Self-Consistency for Blind Image Quality Assessment
item.description: The no-reference image quality assessment is a challenging domain that addresses estimating image quality without the original reference.

item.title: Realistic and Efficient Face Swapping: A Unified Approach with Diffusion Models
item.description: Unlike prior works reliant on multiple off-the-shelf models, ours is a relatively unified approach and so it is resilient to errors in other off-the-shelf models.

item.title: 1M-Deepfakes Detection Challenge
item.description: The detection and localization of deepfake content, particularly when small fake segments are seamlessly mixed with real videos, remains a significant challenge in the field of digital media security.

item.title: Adaptive Adapter Routing for Long-Tailed Class-Incremental Learning
item.description: In this paper, we harness the potent representation capabilities of pre-trained models and introduce AdaPtive Adapter RouTing (APART) as an exemplar-free solution for LTCIL.

item.title: Synthetic continued pretraining
item.description: We propose to bridge this gap with synthetic continued pretraining: using the small domain-specific corpus to synthesize a large corpus more amenable to learning, and then performing continued pretraining on the synthesized corpus.

item.title: Understanding Knowledge Drift in LLMs through Misinformation
item.description: Our experiments reveal that an LLM's uncertainty can increase up to 56. 6% when the question is answered incorrectly due to the exposure to false information.

item.title: Quantifying Knee Cartilage Shape and Lesion: From Image to Metrics
item.description: In this study, we developed a deep-learning-based medical image analysis application for knee cartilage morphometrics, CartiMorph Toolbox (CMT).

item.title: SoftShadow: Leveraging Penumbra-Aware Soft Masks for Shadow Removal
item.description: In view of this, inspired by the physical model of shadow formation, we introduce novel soft shadow masks specifically designed for shadow removal.

item.title: PiTe: Pixel-Temporal Alignment for Large Video-Language Model
item.description: Fueled by the Large Language Models (LLMs) wave, Large Visual-Language Models (LVLMs) have emerged as a pivotal advancement, bridging the gap between image and text.

item.title: Representation Tuning
item.description: Then, I show that a similar effect can be achieved by fine-tuning the vectors directly into the model, by use of a dual loss function based on the cosine similarity of residual stream activations to the vectors combined with a standard token-based loss ("representation tuning").

item.title: MTDA-HSED: Mutual-Assistance Tuning and Dual-Branch Aggregating for Heterogeneous Sound Event Detection
item.description: Sound Event Detection (SED) plays a vital role in comprehending and perceiving acoustic scenes.

item.title: Face Mask Removal with Region-attentive Face Inpainting
item.description: Hence, we propose a generative face inpainting method to effectively recover/reconstruct the masked part of a face.

item.title: Context Enhancement with Reconstruction as Sequence for Unified Unsupervised Anomaly Detection
item.description: By incorporating the RASFormer block, our RAS method achieves superior contextual awareness capabilities, leading to remarkable performance.

item.title: HybridFC: A Hybrid Fact-Checking Approach for Knowledge Graphs
item.description: We consider fact-checking approaches that aim to predict the veracity of assertions in knowledge graphs.

item.title: Weakly-supervised Camera Localization by Ground-to-satellite Image Registration
item.description: To alleviate this issue, this paper proposes a weakly supervised learning strategy for ground-to-satellite image registration when only noisy pose labels for ground images are available for network training.

item.title: LIME-M: Less Is More for Evaluation of MLLMs
item.description: The Semi-Automated Screening Process filters out samples that cannot distinguish the model's capabilities by synthesizing various MLLMs and manually evaluating them.

item.title: Mahalanobis k-NN: A Statistical Lens for Robust Point-Cloud Registrations
item.description: In this paper, we discuss Mahalanobis k-NN: a statistical lens designed to address the challenges of feature matching in learning-based point cloud registration when confronted with an arbitrary density of point clouds, either in the source or target point cloud.

item.title: What is the Role of Small Models in the LLM Era: A Survey
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have made significant progress in advancing artificial general intelligence (AGI), leading to the development of increasingly large models such as GPT-4 and LLaMA-405B.

item.title: UniLearn: Enhancing Dynamic Facial Expression Recognition through Unified Pre-Training and Fine-Tuning on Images and Videos
item.description: To overcome this, we introduce UniLearn, a novel unified learning paradigm that integrates static facial expression recognition (SFER) data to enhance DFER task.

item.title: LLaMA-Omni: Seamless Speech Interaction with Large Language Models
item.description: We build our model based on the latest Llama-3. 1-8B-Instruct model.

item.title: DetailCLIP: Detail-Oriented CLIP for Fine-Grained Tasks
item.description: In this paper, we introduce DetailCLIP: A Detail-Oriented CLIP to address the limitations of contrastive learning-based vision-language models, particularly CLIP, in handling detail-oriented and fine-grained tasks like segmentation.

item.title: GeoCalib: Learning Single-image Calibration with Geometric Optimization
item.description: This single-image calibration can benefit various downstream applications like image editing and 3D mapping.

item.title: gsplat: An Open-Source Library for Gaussian Splatting
item.description: gsplat is an open-source library designed for training and developing Gaussian Splatting methods.

item.title: RealisDance: Equip controllable character animation with realistic hands
item.description: 2) The hands generated using the DWPose sequence are blurry and unrealistic.

item.title: Learning Generative Interactive Environments By Trained Agent Exploration
item.description: Genie, a recent model, excels at learning from visually diverse environments but relies on costly human-collected data.

item.title: Multi-Source Music Generation with Latent Diffusion
item.description: The compressed source latent also facilitates more efficient generation.

item.title: High-Performance Few-Shot Segmentation with Foundation Models: An Empirical Study
item.description: However, the performance of these methods is often constrained by models pre-trained on classification tasks.

item.title: On the Weaknesses of Backdoor-based Model Watermarking: An Information-theoretic Perspective
item.description: Based on this discovery, we propose a novel model watermarking scheme, In-distribution Watermark Embedding (IWE), to overcome the limitations of existing method.

item.title: MENSA: A Multi-Event Network for Survival Analysis under Informative Censoring
item.description: These events are not mutually exclusive and there are often statistical dependencies between them.

item.title: DACAT: Dual-stream Adaptive Clip-aware Time Modeling for Robust Online Surgical Phase Recognition
item.description: In the other stream, DACAT fine-tunes a new frame encoder to extract the frame-wise feature at the current moment.

item.title: ALSS-YOLO: An Adaptive Lightweight Channel Split and Shuffling Network for TIR Wildlife Detection in UAV Imagery
item.description: This improves the extraction of blurry features, crucial for handling jitter-induced blur and overlapping targets.

item.title: TeXBLEU: Automatic Metric for Evaluate LaTeX Format
item.description: LaTeX is highly suited to creating documents with special formatting, particularly in the fields of science, technology, mathematics, and computer science.

item.title: Ferret: Federated Full-Parameter Tuning at Scale for Large Language Models
item.description: To address these limitations, we propose federated full-parameter tuning at scale for LLMs (Ferret), the first first-order method with shared randomness to enable scalable full-parameter tuning of LLMs across decentralized data sources while maintaining competitive model accuracy.
